board.dragHint: Drag to the board on the right.
board.levelCompleted: You finished the level, great job!
board.resetConfirm: This will reset your level, are you sure?
board.tapHint: Tap the board to place a block.
board.title: Board
board.unlockedBlocks: You have unlocked the following blocks
board.unlockedLevels: You have unlocked the following levels

errors.atLeastOneNumber: There should be at least one number on the stack
errors.lessThanTwoNumbers: There are less than two numbers on the stack
errors.multipleBluePortals: Found more than one blue portal.
errors.multipleOrangePortals: Found more than one orange portal.
errors.noBluePortal: Did not find a blue portal.
errors.noMoreNumbers: There are no more numbers to read
errors.noOrangePortal: Did not find an orange portal.
errors.notEnoughNumbers: Not enough numbers on the stack. Need {needed} items.
errors.outOfBoard: You are out of the board
errors.stackEmptyCannotDuplicate: The stack is empty, can not duplicate the last number.
errors.unexpectedResult: You did not finish with the expected result on the stack. Expected: {expected}, Actual: {actual}

instructions.ADD1: Add 1 to the first number on the stack
instructions.BLCK: Don't hit this block, it will kill you
instructions.DUMP: Dump an item from the stack, or pick it up.
instructions.DUP1: Duplicate the last number on the stack
instructions.DUP2: Copy the last two numbers on the stack again.
instructions.EMPT: Check if the stack is empty
instructions.FLP2: Flip-flop between left and right directions
instructions.FLP3: Flip-flop between left, down, and right directions
instructions.FLP4: Flip-flop between all four directions (up, right, down, left)
instructions.GEQ1: Go right if the number is 1 or greater, if not, go down
instructions.INSZ: Get the amount of items still in the input queue.
instructions.MINU: Subtract the top item from the stack from the number below
instructions.PLUS: Add the top two numbers on the stack
instructions.READ: Read a number input onto the stack
instructions.REVA: Reverse all items on the stack
instructions.REVN: Pop N, then reverse the top N items on the stack
instructions.REVR: Revert the direction of the bird
instructions.ROT1: Swap the top two numbers in the stack.
instructions.SIZE: Return the amount of items on the stack
instructions.SRT2: Sort the top 2 items on the stack
instructions.SRTA: Sort all items on the stack
instructions.SRTN: Pop N, then sort the top N items on the stack
instructions.STRT: Initial position of the bird, bird starts going to the right.
instructions.SUB1: Reduce the first number on the stack by one
instructions.SUMA: Sum all the items on the stack
instructions.SUMN: Pop N, then sum the top N items on the stack
instructions.SWAP: Swap the top two numbers on the stack
instructions.VOID: Clear the top item on the stack

0001.description: In this level we don't have to build anything yet

0002.description: In this level we have to place one arrow
0002.hint: Place a DOWN block on the board to guide the bird.

0003.description: In this level we have to go all the way round
0003.hint: Use arrows to make the bird go around the obstacles.

0004.description: In this level we have to go all the way round
0004.hint: Zig and zag to avoid the obstacles.

0005.description: In this level we have to go all the way round
0005.hint: Find the path that leads to the goal.

0006.description: In this level we have to go all the way round
0006.hint: Go up and down like a staircase.

0007.hint: Avoid the blocks and reach the finish.

0008.description: Get your way around the maze
0008.hint: Navigate through the maze to find the exit.

0009.description: This might seem impossible, maybe you have to finish another level first
0009.hint: You might need a special block for this one...

0010.description: In this level we introduce randomness, you have to escape it!
0010.hint: Randomness can be tricky, keep trying!

0101.hint: Find your way through the maze.

1001.hint: Wait for the monster to pass.

1002.hint: Wait for the monster to pass.

1003.hint: Wait for the monster to pass.

1004.hint: Wait for the monster to pass.

2001.description: In this level we have to pick up a number and deliver it to the finish line
2001.hint: Use READ to pick up the number.

2002.description: Pick up two numbers and deliver them to the finish line

2003.description: Pick up two numbers and deliver them to the finish line

2004.description: Pick up two numbers and add them together
2004.hint: Read two numbers and use PLUS.

2005.description: Pick up three numbers and add them together
2005.hint: Read three numbers and use PLUS twice.

2006.description: Pick up a number, copy it and finish with two numbers

2007.description: Pick up a number, if it is less than 1, drop it. If it's higher, bring it to the finish line.
2007.hint: Use GEQ1 to branch based on the number.

2008.description: Pick up a number, make it one larger and bring it to the finish.
2008.hint: Read the number and use ADD1.

2009.description: Pick up a number, make it one smaller and bring it to the finish.
2009.hint: Read the number and use SUB1.

2010.description: Pick up a number, while it is larger than 0, make it smaller. Only come to the finish with 0. Note that all numbers are 0 or larger.
2010.hint: Use a loop with SUB1 and GEQ1.

2011.description: Read all the numbers in the input, and sum them all up. Note, there is always at least one item in the input.
2011.hint: Read all numbers and use PLUS.

2012.description: Read all the numbers in the input, and sum them all up. Now, there are also cases without any input. In which case 0 should be returned.
2012.hint: Read all numbers and use PLUS.

2013.description: Read all the numbers in the input, and just return the total amount of numbers read.
2013.hint: Use READ and keep track of the count.

2014.description: There will be two numbers in the input. Return them in reverse order.
2014.hint: Read two numbers and use SWAP.

2015.description: There will be two numbers in the input. Return only the largest number.
2015.hint: Read two numbers and compare them.

2016.description: There will be two numbers in the input. Return only the smallest number.
2016.hint: Read two numbers and compare them.

2017.description: Take two numbers in the input, say 5 and 1. Return four numbers, 1 5 1 5

menu.ageNote: Made for kids 4+ (and their parents). The kids will probably get stuck at some advanced level, that's normal. Try again a year later!
menu.demoVideoCta: See it in action in the video
menu.gameDescriptionHtml: Stacky Bird is a browser-based puzzle game where you "program" your bird through mazes, monsters, and math by dragging instruction blocks onto the board. Every block is a four-letter opcode (to mimic classic CPU instruction sets), and you can always revisit earlier levels to build cleaner, smarter solutions once you unlock new blocks. The deeper you go the weirder (and cooler) the toolkit gets: READ and PLUS to do stack math, GEQ1 for branching, JMP1 to vault walls, PRTI/PRTO portals to warp across the map, NOTE to ring a bell, and even YOLO when you feel brave.
menu.hiddenInstructionsCount: There are {hiddenInstructionCount} more instruction blocks to be discovered. Finish levels to unlock them.
menu.hiddenLevelsCount: There are {hiddenLevelCount} more levels still hidden
menu.instructionBlocksDescription: The following blocks are available in your solutions. If they are greyed out, you still have to unlock them. Hover over the instructions to see what they do.
menu.levelsDescription: Complete these levels to unlock new instructions. Later on, you can come back and improve your solutions! Click a level to start playing.
menu.metaInfo: I work on this project every couple of years. See
menu.metaInfoEnd: for more information about the creator. If you have big ideas with Stacky Bird, I'm also happy to hand over the idea.
menu.noLevelsFinished: You have not finished any levels yet!
menu.resetComplete: Ok, everything is wiped. Reloading from scratch.
menu.resetConfirm: ARE YOU SURE YOU WANT TO WIPE ALL YOUR PROGRESS?
menu.subtitle: This is Stacky Bird, a game to learn programming for kids (4+) as well as a revolutionary programming language (ðŸ˜‚) by itself.
menu.title: Stacky Bird
